azureResourceGraph.query:
Resources
| where type == "microsoft.compute/virtualmachines"
| where name == "$VM"
| where resourceGroup == "$resourceGroup"
| where subscriptionId == "$subscription"
| project 
osDiskname          = properties.storageProfile.osDisk.name, 
diskSizeGB          = properties.storageProfile.osDisk.diskSizeGB, 
caching             = properties.storageProfile.osDisk.caching,
osDiskId            = tolower(tostring(properties.storageProfile.osDisk.managedDisk.id))
| join kind=leftouter (
 Resources 
 | where type =~ 'microsoft.compute/disks'
 | extend osDiskId=tolower(tostring(id))
 | where properties !has 'Unattached'
 | where properties has 'osType'
 | project 
 diskMBpsReadWrite = properties.diskMBpsReadWrite,
 diskIOPSReadWrite = properties.diskIOPSReadWrite,
 osType = properties.osType,
 tier = properties.tier,
 sku = sku.name,
 osDiskId
) on $left.osDiskId == $right.osDiskId
| project osDiskId, osType, diskSizeGB, tier, sku, diskIOPSReadWrite, diskMBpsReadWrite, caching

Resources 
| where type == "microsoft.compute/virtualmachines"
| where name == "$VM"
| where subscriptionId == "$subscription"
| where resourceGroup == "$resourceGroup"
| mv-expand dataDisk=properties.storageProfile.dataDisks
| extend diskId = tolower(tostring(dataDisk.managedDisk.id))
| extend diskName          = dataDisk.name
| extend diskSizeGB  = dataDisk.diskSizeGB
| extend diskCaching             = dataDisk.caching
| extend diskLun = toint(dataDisk.lun)
| extend diskWriteAcceleratorEnabled = dataDisk.writeAcceleratorEnabled
 | join kind=leftouter (
 Resources 
 | where type =~ 'microsoft.compute/disks'
 | where properties !has "osType"
 | where properties !has 'Unattached'
 | extend diskId=tolower(tostring(id))
 | extend diskIOPSReadWrite=properties.diskIOPSReadWrite
 | extend diskMBpsReadWrite=properties.diskMBpsReadWrite
 | extend tier=properties.tier
 | extend encryption=properties.encryption.type
 | extend skuName=sku.name
 ) on diskId
 | project lun=diskLun, diskId, sizeGB=diskSizeGB, tier, sku=skuName, diskIOPSReadWrite, diskMBpsReadWrite, caching=diskCaching, writeAcceleratorEnabled=diskWriteAcceleratorEnabled, encryption
 | order by lun asc

panels.description: The number of total bytes that are read in a second from all disks attached to a VM.
panels.title: Disk Read Bytes/Sec

panels.description: The number of input operations that are read in a second from all disks attached to a VM.
panels.title: Disk Read Operations/Sec

panels.description: The number of bytes that are written in a second from all disks attached to a VM.
panels.title: Disk Write Bytes/Sec

panels.description: The number of output operations that are written in a second from all disks attached to a VM.
panels.title: Disk Write Operations/Sec

panels.description: The number of bytes that are read in a second from the OS disk.
panels.title: OS Disk Read Bytes/Sec

panels.description: The number of input operations that are read in a second from the OS disk.
panels.title: OS Disk Read Operations/Sec

panels.description: The number of bytes that are written in a second from the OS disk.
panels.title: OS Disk Write Bytes/Sec

panels.description: The number of output operations that are written in a second from the OS disk.
panels.title: OS Disk Write Operations/Sec

panels.description: The number of current outstanding IO requests that are waiting to be read from or written to the OS disk.
panels.title: OS Disk Queue Depth

panels.description: The number of bytes that are read in a second from the data disk(s).
panels.title: Data Disk Read Bytes/Sec

panels.description: The number of input operations that are read in a second from data disk(s).
panels.title: Data Disk Read Operations/Sec

panels.description: The number of bytes that are written in a second from the data disk(s).
panels.title: Data Disk Write Bytes/Sec

panels.description: The number of output operations that are written in a second from data disk(s).
panels.title: Data Disk Write Operations/Sec

panels.description: The number of current outstanding IO requests that are waiting to be read from or written to the data disk(s).
panels.title: Data Disk Queue Depth

panels.description: The percentage calculated by the total IOPS completed over the max cached virtual machine IOPS limit. If this amount is at 100%, your application running is IO capped from your VM's cached IOPS limit.
panels.title: VM Cached IOPS Consumed Percentage

panels.description: The percentage calculated by the total disk throughput completed over the max cached virtual machine throughput. If this amount is at 100%, your application running is IO capped from your VM's cached bandwidth limit.
panels.title: VM Cached Bandwidth Consumed Percentage

panels.description: The percentage calculated by the total IOPS on a virtual machine completed over the max uncached virtual machine IOPS limit. If this amount is at 100%, your application running is IO capped from your VM's uncached IOPS limit.
panels.title: VM Uncached IOPS Consumed Percentage

panels.description: The percentage calculated by the total disk throughput on a virtual machine completed over the max provisioned virtual machine throughput. If this amount is at 100%, your application running is IO capped from your VM's uncached bandwidth limit.
panels.title: VM Uncached Bandwidth Consumed Percentage

panels.description: The percentage calculated by the OS disk IOPS completed over the provisioned OS disk IOPS. If this amount is at 100%, your application running is IO capped from your OS disk's IOPS limit.
panels.title: OS Disk IOPS Consumed Percentage

panels.description: The percentage calculated by the OS disk throughput completed over the provisioned OS disk throughput. If this amount is at 100%, your application running is IO capped from your OS disk's bandwidth limit.
panels.title: OS Disk Bandwidth Consumed Percentage

panels.description: The percentage calculated by the data disk IOPS completed over the provisioned data disk IOPS. If this amount is at 100%, your application running is IO capped from your data disk's IOPS limit.
panels.title: Data Disk IOPS Consumed Percentage

panels.description: The percentage calculated by the data disk throughput completed over the provisioned data disk throughput. If this amount is at 100%, your application running is IO capped from your data disk's bandwidth limit.
panels.title: Data Disk Bandwidth Consumed Percentage

panels.description: The accumulated percentage of the VMs cached IOPS burst used. Emitted on a 5 minute interval.

azureMonitor.metricName: VM Local Used Burst IO Credits Percentage

panels.title: VM Cached Used Burst IO Credits Percentage

panels.description: The accumulated percentage of the VMs cached IOPS burst used. Emitted on a 5 minute interval.

azureMonitor.metricName: VM Local Used Burst BPS Credits Percentage

panels.title: VM Cached Used Burst BPS Credits Percentage

panels.description: The accumulated percentage of the VMs uncached IOPS burst used. Emitted on a 5 minute interval.

azureMonitor.metricName: VM Remote Used Burst IO Credits Percentage

panels.title: VM Uncached Used Burst IO Credits Percentage

panels.description: The accumulated percentage of the VMs uncached throughput burst used. Emitted on a 5 minute interval.

azureMonitor.metricName: VM Remote Used Burst BPS Credits Percentage

panels.title: VM Uncached Used Burst BPS Credits Percentage

panels.description: The accumulated percentage of the IOPS burst used for the OS disk. Emitted on a 5 minute interval.

azureMonitor.metricName: OS Disk Used Burst IO Credits Percentage

panels.title: OS Disk Used Burst IO Credits Percentage

panels.description: The accumulated percentage of the throughput burst used for the OS disk. Emitted on a 5 minute interval.

azureMonitor.metricName: OS Disk Used Burst BPS Credits Percentage

panels.title: OS Disk Used Burst BPS Credits Percentage

panels.description: The accumulated percentage of the IOPS burst used for the data disk(s). Emitted on a 5 minute interval.

azureMonitor.metricName: Data Disk Used Burst BPS Credits Percentage

panels.title: Data Disk Used Burst IO Credits Percentage

panels.description: The accumulated percentage of the throughput burst used for the data disk(s). Emitted on a 5 minute interval.

azureMonitor.metricName: Data Disk Used Burst BPS Credits Percentage

panels.title: Data Disk Used Burst BPS Credits Percentage

panels.description: The IOPS limit that the data disk(s) can achieve without bursting.
panels.title: OS Disk Target IOPS

panels.description: The throughput limit that the OS disk can achieve without bursting.
panels.title: OS Disk Target Bandwidth

panels.description: The IOPS limit that the data disk(s) can achieve without bursting.
panels.title: Data Disk Target IOPS

panels.description: The throughput limit that the data(s) disk can achieve without bursting.
panels.title: Data Disk Target Bandwidth

panels.description: The IOPS limit that the OS disk can burst up to.
panels.title: OS Disk Max Burst IOPS

panels.description: The throughput limit that the OS disk can burst up to.
panels.title: OS Disk Max Burst Bandwidth

panels.description: The IOPS limit that the data disk(s) can burst up to.
panels.title: Data Disk Max Burst IOPS

panels.description: The throughput limit that the data disk(s) can burst up to
panels.title: Data Disk Max Burst Bandwidth
